bug.author: pbmstrk
bug.summary: Error in logging of Regression Metrics
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When attempting to log a regression metric object as described <denchmark-link:https://pytorch-lightning.readthedocs.io/en/stable/metrics.html#>here</denchmark-link> when training for more than one epoch, the following error occurs, <denchmark-code>RuntimeError: Only Tensors created explicitly by the user (graph leaves) support the deepcopy protocol at the moment </denchmark-code>
Interestingly, this error only occurs when using regression metrics. For example, Accuracy() works without any problems. <denchmark-h:h3>Boring Model Link</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1dVJAq-jrgaFfdsSmjTBbrCVRnQ2ywNNC?usp=sharing>Link</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Logging should work for all metrics. When comparing to metrics that work it seems that in the case of the regression metrics some of the variables (e.g. sum_squared_error) are still attached to the computational graph - which seems to be the cause of the problem. If I add the line, <denchmark-code>preds = preds.detach() </denchmark-code>
to the update() method everything seems to work. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
see colab.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pbmstrk>@pbmstrk</denchmark-link> mind sending in a PR with .detach fix?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pbmstrk>@pbmstrk</denchmark-link> actually there are other issues with detaching or keeping attached metrics which are discussed here, so maybe wait for <denchmark-link:https://github.com/SkafteNicki>@SkafteNicki</denchmark-link> to send in a PR for the base class and see if that resolves the issue itself. Discussion here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/issues/4098>#4098</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pbmstrk>@pbmstrk</denchmark-link> just pushed a commit to PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/pull/4313>#4313</denchmark-link> that solves the bug (confirmed by running colab model) :] Basically had to call detach within the code (only objects did not automatically get detached, which is rectified now in the PR)
